body_html: I think it makes sense to use OrderedDict in nn::Modules because parameters and submodules should be inherently ordered, as they are also in PyTorch. It removes the need for the std::map in the parameters() function, which was manually ordering them. Since @zdevito had already implemented OrderedDict at the time (this was a month ago), I just took it and extended it a little. It's also useful for cursors (PR is ready, just waiting for this one first), which iterate over the OrderedDicts
